doc:
Vanni Marcoux https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vanni_Marcoux 0 Jean-Émile Diogène Marcoux (12 June 1877 – 22 October 1962) was a French operatic bass-baritone, known professionally as Vanni Marcoux (sometimes hyphenated as Vanni-Marcoux). He was particularly associated with the French and Italian repertories. His huge repertoire included an estimated 240 roles and he won renown as one of the most memorable singing-actors of the 20th century. Jean-Émile_Diogène_Marcoux ( 12_June_1877 – 22_October_1962 ) was a_French_operatic_bass-baritone , known professionally as Vanni_Marcoux ( sometimes_hyphenated as Vanni-Marcoux ) . He was_particularly_associated with the_French_and_Italian_repertories . His_huge_repertoire included an_estimated_240_roles and he won renown as one of the_most_memorable_singing-actors of the_20th_century .
